For program1.py:
The problem is about partitioning an array to maximize the sum of values of subarrays. The value of a subarray is the length of the subarray multiplied by the sign of its sum (positive: +1, zero: 0, negative: -1).

The provided code uses dynamic programming and Fenwick trees (or segment trees) to compute the maximum sum. The missing part is inside the loop for i in range(1, n+1). After updating dp[i], we have:
    if dp[i] > dmx.get(pref[i], -INF):
        # TODO: Your code here

We are to update the dictionary dmx for the key pref[i] (which is the prefix sum at index i) with the value dp[i]. This is because the recurrence uses the fact that if the same prefix sum has been seen before, we can use the stored value (which is the maximum dp[j] for j with the same prefix sum) to update a future state.

So we should set:
    dmx[pref[i]] = dp[i]

But note: the recurrence already uses dmx.get(pref[i], -INF) in the expression for dp[i]. And after we compute dp[i], if it is greater than the current value for the same prefix, we update it.

Therefore, the missing line is:
    dmx[pref[i]] = dp[i]
